intro: Boltonia asteroides var. latisquama, commonly known as the broad-leaf boltonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features tall, branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, adorned with large, showy white to pale pink composite flower heads. The plant has broad, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowering period typically occurs in late summer to early autumn, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks.
